title: Strengthening AI Practical Competencies: Optimizing Phase 1 Oncology Clinical Trial Design: Theory and Practice

context.prior_knowledge: Basic clinical trial concepts and foundational statistics
context.additional_context: Advanced AI/machine learning technical course for AI/ML practitioners

learning_goals: Cultivating the ability to develop phase I oncology clinical trial plans applying Bayesian optimization design principles.

At the end of a 4-week course, learners create a comparative table of key principles, pros/cons, and application scenarios of EWOC (increasing capacity control) and c-optimal design, and write a 2-page comparative report scoring 4+ points (5-point scale) in 2+ of 3 evaluation criteria (clarity, systematic comparison, practicality). Additionally, learners must include concrete examples applying both methodologies to actual AI experiment designs (e.g., hyperparameter tuning, resource allocation)

Within 2–4 weeks, learners design an optimal capacity exploration process for a given AI system (e.g., recommendation algorithm) satisfying safety (risk score ≤ 0.3) and efficiency (processing speed ≥ 100ms) constraints, validate it 3+ times in a simulation environment, and achieve an average performance score of 85+ points
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
